translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Chapter with Tinnudāyaka, etc.
The Story of the Elder Abbhañjanadāyaka
“In the city of Bandhumatī,
I lived in the king’s pleasure park;
I was then a leather worker,
carrying a water pot.
I saw the stainless Buddha,
the self-dependent, unconquered one;
He was striving, intent,
a meditator, a master of meditation.
He had fulfilled all his wishes,
had crossed over the flood, was without pollutants;
Seeing him, I was pleased and happy,🔽and gave him a polishing tool.
For ninety-one eons
the gift I gave then,
I do not know of any bad destination,
this is the fruit of the polishing tool.
My defilements are burned up,
I live without pollutants.
Welcome indeed it was for me,
the Buddha’s instruction has been fulfilled.
The four analytical knowledges,
the Buddha’s instruction has been fulfilled.”🔽Thus the elder Abbhañjanadāyaka recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā abbhañjanadāyako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Abbhañjanadāyakattherassāpadānaṁ catutthaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmai abbhañjanadāyakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽abbhañjanadāyaka therassa apadānam catuttha
translated: The Story of the Elder Abbhañjanadāyaka is the fourth.
